name: Phil
introtext:
This year, I traveled across the country and then moved from Philadelphia to Santa Fe. Most of the year was filled with adventure and fun but also inconsistency and large changes. When I look back on what I was listening to most, I see that music primarily served as my comfort food. I found most of these songs in years past, and I listened to them for their familiarity.

Also, sometimes I like to play a single song on repeat for hours when I drive or write code. It makes time sort of melt away. Many of these songs served that purpose.

songs.description: I listened to this song on repeat last year when I cathartically cleaned my apartment for many hours while having a beautiful moment of self-reflection. I listened to it a lot this year to channel that feeling.

I listened to this on repeat last year when I decided to quit my previous job. I heard my excitement reflected in the eager and aggressive guitar licks. I listened to it for the same reason this year when I embarked on my trip and when I decided to move.
I listened to this song a lot as I grew tired of living in big cities and longed to move somewhere with easier access to "big nature."

I used to listen to this song and others by Edward Sharp and the Magnetic Zeros a lot in high school. I would watch their (in hindsight kitschy) music videos depicting hippies wandering through the desert. I'd watch these videos in my childhood bed with wanderlust. This year I spent a lot of weeks living out of my car, in deserts and mountains. I listened to this song a lot this year with the part-amusing part-tacky notion that my younger self would be impressed that I was "living my dream."

The album art for this song was on a skateboard that my cousin gave me when I was quite young. I tried to keep it hidden from my parents. I no longer have the skateboard but I was pleased this year when I stumbled upon this album. The song is quite beautiful and I found it funny that it had an album artwork from my childhood skateboard.

songs.songname: Some Things Last a Long Time
songs.description: I find this to be a hauntingly beautiful song. Daniel Johnston's slightly off-key voice delivers the simple, sentimental lyrics with candor. The haunting and melancholy piano tune plods along through the song. I listened to this a lot when I was processing some emotional and challenging moments from this year.
A song similar to this song played in the background of a snowboarding game for Wii I used to play as a kid. I like how this song sounds and it makes me feel vaguely nostalgic.
